description: This file provides utility functions for reading property values from files, reading file contents, checking if a path is a regular file, searching files recursively with pattern matching and exclusions, and processing strings with variable expansion. It is part of a project dealing with file and property management in the Utils namespace.

methods.name: bool readPropertyFromFile(const char * filename,const string & property,string & propertyValue)
methods.description: Reads a property value from a specified file based on a property name, supporting recursive expansion if the property value starts with '$'.

methods.name: bool readFileContent(const char * filename,string & content)
methods.description: Reads the entire content of a specified file into a string.

methods.name: bool isRegularFile(const string & path)
methods.description: Checks whether a given path corresponds to a regular file.

methods.name: bool searchFilesRec(std::vector<std::string> & pathList,unsigned int currentDepth,const std::list<string> & exclusions,string & result)
methods.description: Recursively searches directories with pattern matching, exclusions, and a result limit.

methods.name: bool searchFiles(string & inputPath,int maxDepth,int minDepth,const std::list<string> & exclusions,string & result)
methods.description: Initiates a recursive file search starting from a given path, with specified depth limits and exclusions.

methods.name: bool ExpandPropertiesInString(const char * input,const char * filePath,string & expandedString)
methods.description: Expands variables within a string by replacing placeholders with property values read from a file.
